reviews.review_msg: This Cost Benefit Analysis course was a lot of fun.  His lecture notes are brief and concise.  His quizes make you think but are not impossible to do.  His tests are very predictable and easy if you study the lecture notes.  Great Prof.
This Cost and Benefits class was very very boring. Cox is a horrible lecturer. His quizes are hard, but his tests are soo predictable.
Cox is okay~  Only read notes for the midterm and final is enough...
assignments and textbook are completely unrelated to exams

Workplace Participation - not sure how this is an Econ course but it was all concepts (words), no math. Just need you to read all materials and MEMORIZE them WELL. Doesn't grade on curve. Easy course overall, memorize all material, A- or B+ should not be a problem.
Unclear Lectures, easy to pass, hard to get A
The best proff...easy to get a A plus...
wow~amazingly well prof! he is pretty good looking, and his lecture notes are very informative...however, he is a lazy prof =P (*hint: find past exam and study them, u'll ace all of the exams)
Very good prof!!  He's always happy to talk and help solving problems.  Easy going & quick response by emails!  I did learn something from the course.

This class was about financial crisis and it was pretty fun class. Materials were helpful and prof has a lot of knowledge about financial crisis too. He just does not email you back. One midterm was easy and another midterm was relatively hard and final was pretty fair. I've learned a lot from this class.

Note: my class only had 9 students. The format of this class was different than any I've ever had before, and that made it difficult to know what was expected. He often used a lot of complicated math (and not always well explained), but you only needed to understand the premises and conclusions of the models. Very willing to help out of class.
Take this class. Aced it. Midterm easy. Final easier. Start your term paper early. About ten pages. Class very interesting. Not a single boring moment.
